Reviews.Title: READ THE MANUAL!!!  This is a great camera if you learn how to use it correctly!
Reviews.Author: M. Randall "Meg R"
Reviews.Content: When I first turned on the camera and started taking pictures, I too noticed the grainy quality of the pictures.  Then I started reading the manual!  What a great idea, huh?  It has different "scenes" in which you can choose whatever current situation you are in while taking the picture.  If you press the scene button, you can select up to 18 different scenes in which to take your pictures.  You can choose anything from museum (no flash)and sporting events, to candlelight/parties and fireworks!  All you need to do is select what's right for the situation you're in.  You can also select auto scene where the camera will automatically select which scene it thinks you're in.  This is a great camera!!  I love being able to turn my photos to black & white and sepia, and write little notes on them.  You can also record messages to go with your pictures!  I love the large touch screen, and being able to touch-up the pictures directly on the camera!  Bottom line is, if you know how to use the camera, you shouldn't have a problem, and you'll most likely love it just as much as I do!

Reviews.Title: Strong compact camera with quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Iceman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter to replace a beat up 5MP pocket camera (Samsung) that used batteries up like no tomorrow. It was a competent little camera but it was time for an upgrade for her. At 16 years old it was time for her to have an update for taking snapshots of family and friends and to give her the ability to document our many family vacations. I own a Nikon DSLR that is up in the 1,000 to 2k dollar range and it gets frequent use and has been quite durable. The issue with it is size. This camera is no where near as advanced as my DSLR but it is quite competent for a camera in its price range.For those critics out there who have had issues with picture quality READ THE OWNERS MANUAL!! This is a very easy camera to use right out of the box but to get the most out of it you need to choose the right mode for the type of photo you are taking. It seems many are reporting grainy photos or problems with image quality. We have never seen that with this camera. It is small, has a decent lens with a rechargeable battery and takes SDHC memory which allows larger capacity SD memory cards. I was able to pair this camera with a 8gb SDHC memory card I found for 18.00. That will give this camera the ability to take well over 500 photos.I picked this camera up for 200.00 and I feel its a good value for that price with the touchscreen, rechargeable battery, good lens and solid build quality. If you don't want to read the manual and take a little time getting familiar with the many features of the camera then move on. Reading is fundamental! LOL

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: J. Hall
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a brainless alternative to my full-featured high end DSLR. Guess which one comes with me everywhere? It's so easy to shoot with this little pocket camera, and so guiltless. Easy to use, small and convenient. I have no issues with the image quality. Then again, I know what the high end looks like, so maybe my expectations are more reasonable. You gets what you pays for - and I like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: NJ
Reviews.Author: NJ
Reviews.Content: This Nikon Coolpix S230 camera is Awesome!  Love the 3 inch touch screen. It's easy to use and takes great photos.  I would highly recommend purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Church
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera!  The people who give this camera bad reviews apparently do not know how to use the camera properly.  Read the owner's manual and it works fantastic!

Reviews.Title: No blury pictures, just crisp/clear.  Love it
Reviews.Author: saugus32
Reviews.Content: I may have not bought my Nikon Coolpix S230 (Plum) On Amazon but I love mine.  I did my reviews to choice between Nikon/Kodak/Samsung.  Trust me I wanted Samsung badley as it had display view front/back, but the price was just too high for me to afford.  I found my Nikon in BJ Wholesale store under $200.00, which price at the store and on line said for $189, but I only paid at the register $169. I bought it home, charged the battery, took some test picture of my cat, my husband, printed it and I was amazed how clear, crisp and bright the pictures were, even in the room with no lights hardley can be seen of my cat.  The reason I bought this camera is we are going to the football game and since our seat is in a great spot, I wanted a camera where I didn't have to do much with, except turn it on, zoom in if I had to and take picture and I found this camera has and will do this for me.  Also, I can take as many pictures I want and I can at the same time I can view it, delete it right on the spot.  Love it, love it and I am so glad I got it.  I am not a photographer my all mean, but when I look for cameras, I look MP/Optical Zoom and length of the LCD, and I got everything in this camera. I now know I made the right choice for touch screen I wanted.Try it and I know you will like it as I know I am glad I got it and thrilled with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Foster "mckennamom"
Reviews.Content: I have had this since Mothers Day and it's now October.  Never had a problem with it! It is a great camera. I think those who are complaining about blury pics are not using the camera correctly.  You do need to play with settings on any camera to have the correct lighting, object, etc settings so you can take the optimum pic.  Although it is a point and shoot, it does have several features and functions that make it great, but apparently have turned some people off.  It also means that some will not take the time to change the settings after opening the box.  It's unfortunate because this is one of the few cameras I tried that took quick clear pics of my 1 and 3 year olds.  Hopefully people will take a chance on this camera because it is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: A great compact camera
Reviews.Author: flower "rain"
Reviews.Content: I wanted one small, light and good looking.  This one is smaller and lighter that Canon sd870 I wanted to buy, does not like Canon Sd790 give a lot red eyes.  I took some pixs of my children sleeping with no light on, came out wonderful, better than Canon sd790's pixs.  And, it is SO easy to use, all are automatic.Cons: Needs the cord to charge battery.

Reviews.Title: Why The Negative Reviews??
Reviews.Author: Shop-A-Holic "BeeBee"
Reviews.Content: I was browsing for a fun digital camera for weeks! I searched high and low, visited many different stores, browsed online. You name it, I did it. Finally I came across this nifty touchscreen camera. It came in four different colors, and seemed pretty durable. I read the reviews and I second-guessed myself from purchasing it. Half the reviews were really good and half were really bad. So I decided to go against the bad reviews and try it out for myself. The camera is so easy to use. The touchscreen (which is plastic) is great. It doesnt leave behind finger prints or anything! And there's no glare which is nice. People complained how cheap that is... but it makes the camera nice, and light-weight! Anyhow, next complaint was POOR picture quality. All you need to do is change the ISO and ta-da, no more grainy pics. The features are endless on it! You can totally edit your pics right on the camera, add cute little frames and stamps and even doodle on pics. Its a lot of fun! And a heck of a lot cheaper than other touchscreen cameras I came across. Read the manual, and once you know how this cool camera works, I promise, you will be SO happy with it. If anyone has any questions or concerns, I would be delighted to help!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Camera S230 Touch Screen LCD
Reviews.Author: John T. Emig "Master Gardener"
Reviews.Content: Camera was shipped by Shutterbug.  Arrived earlier than stated. LCD screen is difficult to use outside.  This is the only drawback.  Easy to use and transfer pictures to computer.

Reviews.Title: My LIttle Miracle Camera - Nikon Coolpix S230 10 MP
Reviews.Author: Viv "Viv in TX"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and Easy to produce pictures that look like a far more expensive camera!  You have the option to place your choices on Auto and point and shoot with the same incredible results - or just use some manual controls to control other options.  I love the auto flash, no red eye, and the ability to take pictures of kids/animals in motion - no blurs!!!I LOVE the touch tone BIG WORDS screen!  3" and no small icons to try to figure out or remember what they stand for!  The anti-reflective screen on the LCD make it easier to see in sunlight!!!!It comes with 44mb internal memory! It has cords to attach it for viewing on TV and on the computer!  The rechargeable battery comes with a very quick charger (from no charge to full charge in 100 minutes or less).Thank you, Nikon!!!  I love this little camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s230
Reviews.Author: Ross Wilber "IT Guy"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, takes great pictures, thanks to one of the previous reviewers that described how to set the mode to automatic.  Worked great, unfortunately I purchased this for someone else, can't wait for my two year old HP to break so I can get one for myself.The touch screen is awesome, reduces the clutter of buttons to just a couple, I didn't realize how small this thing was until I opened the box.  I thought my HP was small, this isn't much bigger than the 3" screen.Be sure to get the s230 and NOT the s220, there is a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Holland
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. My boyfriend and I have bought it due to our first child's upcoming arrival in a couple of weeks. We've been playing around with it and seeing all it's features for the past two weeks.The features on this camera are unbeatable and for 10 MP, it's a great price. There's some cool features like "smile" mode. The camera detects when your subject is smiling and will take the shot for you. It also has a great feature called "blink" mode. The camera can detect if someone is blinking, will ask you to check before it saves to the camera. Or you can just take another one to be sure. The picture quality is great. Some seem slightly grainy on the 3" LCD screen but once you upload them to your computer they're fine. It has a few modification options to change your pictures, ie. Black & White, Sepia Tone, Vivid Color, etc. My other favorite feature, which was not talked about anywhere is the "Panorama" mode. The camera assists you in placement of pictures to help you take a panoramic picture. And you can take as many as you want! The touch screen is really cool also. Oh, and it takes video!To sum it all up...this is a great camera. And at a great price. I would absolutely buy it again and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Skeptical.......
Reviews.Author: D. Miller "photo taker"
Reviews.Content: At first after reading some of the horrible reviews i was skeptical about getting this camera. I ordered it anyway and it got here very fast (2 days). As soon as i got it i put in the battery and started taking pictures...they were grainy! So i read the manual and put it on an automatic scene mode that picks the best scene mode for your current picture. Problem solved! I downloaded pictures onto my computer and the pictures looked even clearer.i love this camera i would say buy it!

Reviews.Title: Got to love a Nikon
Reviews.Author: Diane Marie Sworan
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd. digital camera, my last one was a Nikon, and I was happy with it until I dropped it...:(I checked the CoolPix out and many stores. One day I saw it on Amazon, the price was excellent, and I saw FREE SHIPPING.BINGO....I hit the order button.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its price.
Reviews.Author: E. Krinker
Reviews.Content: I own Nikon DSLR and yes S230 camera won't produce as nice of a quality pics as my DSLR, but my DSLR won't fit in my pocket and much more expensive. So I got this camera to take quick pics when I go out and when I don't want to take my expensive camera since I am paranoid about damaging it. Also S230 has ability to take  videos up to 30 min. Great thing in my opinion. About grainy pictures - yes, they will be grainy if you are shooting in a poorly lit room since camera adjusts its ISO way up. Guess what my DSLR would do exact same thing if I were to crank my ISO to 1600, but I don't do it and I use flash and longer exposure to produce better looking pics. Exact same thing can be achieved with this camera if you were to take a picture with a night portrait mode. Try it before criticizing the camera and like others said, please read the manual.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera with cool features
Reviews.Author: J. Moses
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this camera for my boyfriend and he loves it. Touch screen feature is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Photo Quality, Just Select ISO 200
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: Excelent Camera, for those who said "grainy photos"...... just take the camera, select ISO 200 and thats it.... excelent photo quality, easy to use. This camera came with great ISO quality more than common cameras, just select 80, 100 or 200. Believe me this is an excelent camera.Just do it!Turn on the cameraçMenuISO sensitivitySelect 80,100 or 200 (In the night better 200)And thats it, excelent pics...

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX S230 10MP
Reviews.Author: Jose Galicia "okeylang_47"
Reviews.Content: HI EVERYONE,  THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE PERSON WHO IS REALLY LOOKING FOR A GOOD UN-BIAS REVIEW. IM 30YR.OLD GUY WHO REALLY LOVES THE DIGITAL AND ELECTRONIC WORLD & STUFF... I DID MY RESEARCH READ THE REVIEWS WATCH THE VIDEO REVIEWS AND ALL THAT STUFF BUT NOTHING SEEMS TO EXPLAIN MORE ABOUT THE REALITY OF HAVING ONE OF IT...LETS TALK ABOUT THE PICTURE QUALITY ...  YES IT HAS GOOD PICTURE QUALITY BUT NOT EXCELLENT I WILL RATE IT AS A 4 STAR ... ABOUT THESE PEOPLE THAT WAS SAYING IT HAS A BAD PICTURE >>> BUBBLY,SANDY,GRAINY AND ALL THAT... THEY ARE ALSO TRUE !!! THEY ARE SOME PICTURE THAT ARE ACTUALLY GRAINY BLURRED AND A CELLPHONE-LIKE PHOTO'S ... BUT YOU HAVE TO CHOOSE THE RIGHT SETTING FOR IT FOR THE RIGHT SITUATION AND LOCATION - LIKE INDOORS/PARTY AND STUFF, NIGHT-PHOTO SHOTS, THE BACKGROUND LIGHTING, AND ALL THAT STUFF. ABOUT THE NIGHT SHOTS I WILL CONSIDER IT AS AN EXCELLENT NIGHT SHOOTER THE PICTURE IS ALMOST AS GOOD AS WHEN THE SUN IS UP WELL OF COURSE THE CLOSER THE TARGET IS THE BETTER... CLOSE UP PICTURES ARE ALSO FAIR... BUT IT WILL BE ON ITS BEST ON ABOUT 3-5 FEET ON A SUNLIGHT SITUATION OR EVEN FARTHER... DONT GET FOOLED ABOUT THE MEGA PIXELS IT DOESN'T MEAN THAT YOU SET YOUR CAMERA ON ITS MAXIMUM PICTURE SIZE IT MEANS THAT YOU WOULD GET THE BEST PICTURE QUALITIES - TAKE NOTE THAT MORE STEADY HANDS CAN TAKE MORE BETTER QUALITY PICTURESQUALITY PICTURES - YOU CAN GET THAT ON THE TYPE OF THE CAMERA LENSES... OF COURSE THE BETTER LENS THE BETTER PICTURE OUTPUT ... AND ON THIS CAMERA NIKON S230, THE PICTURE IS JUST FAIR THE PRICE I'D PAYED FOR IS JUST MATCHES THE QUALITY OF THE PRODUCT... I WILL STILL CONSIDER IT THAT I'M STILL A WINNER BY CHOOSING THIS CAMERA... MONEY WISE QUALITY WISE ...ABOUT THE PHYSICAL QUALITY OF THE CAMERA,  THE CAMERA IS LIGHT AND ITS EVEN LIGHTER THAN MY BLACKBERRY CURVE (CELLPHONE) SOME PEOPLE LIKE IT HEAVY AND AS SOLID AS POSSIBLE AND SOME LIKE IT LIGHT .. LIKE ME I WOULD LIKE IT HEAVIER THAN WHAT IT IS ANYWAY THE RATINGS ARE ALSO FAIR THE DESIGN IS NICE ITS COMPACT SMALL AND CUTE 5 STAR ON THATADVICE - WHATS GOOD AND WHATS NOT  IF YOU ARE THE TYPE OF PERSON THAT JUST WANT TO POINT AND SHOT THIS IS NOT FOR YOU THIS CAMERA WILL BE MORE APPRECIATED IF YOU FIND THE RIGHT SETTING FOR THE RIGHT SITUATION AND LOCATION ... IT WILL BE MORE SETTINGS THAN YOU WOULD THOUGHT AND ITS A TOUCH SCREEN... THAT WOULD GIVE YOU SOME DIFFICULTIES TOO IF YOU DONT USE THE POINTER THE 3INCHES SCREEN IS FAIR BUT(PLASTIC)... AND THE PICTURE WILL BE BETTER TO SEE ON YOUR COMPUTER OR MONITORIF YOU HAVE A QUESTION EMAIL ME... [...]AND I WILL TRY TO ANSWER WHAT YOU NEED MORE TO KNOW...THANK YOU FOR READING MY REVIEWI SHOULD PUT 4 STAR BUT 5 STAR IS WHAT YOU GUYS READ TO COMPARE IT JUST TO 1 STAR AND THIS IS WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT... HEHEHE GOT CHA ...

Reviews.Title: Nikkon Touch Scream.
Reviews.Author: Norman A. Belanger
Reviews.Content: This camera is the worst camera I have ever used.The quality of the picture on the touch screen is grainyand very poor. I spent hours adjusting settings and could notimprove the quality. Even when connected to the high def TVthe quality was awful. I returned this camera and purchased a Cannon thatis awesome.Maybe I just got stuck with a lemon Nikon but that just shows thattheir quality control is poor. I don't think I will ever buy anotherNikon.

Reviews.Title: does horrible outside with sun, pictures and video
Reviews.Author: Tara Martin "Tara Martin"

} } } Length:: 0:52 MinsThis camera takes horrible shots. I bought it before moving to a Pacific island and boy was I wrong. It does horrible with sunlight, leaving vertical streaks through the pictures. The video quality is also bad, especially if you're outside with sun - again, vertical streaks everywhere. I could talk about the positive features, but unfortunately if it doesn't take good pictures, it's not worth it. I have played with all the options and read the entire manual to try to overcome these problems, but it's just a crappy camera. I have experience with much better cameras in the past, and feel my cellphone can do better that this camera.The video I'm attaching to this is taken in Washington State. You can see the horrible effect the sun has on the image. There are no settings other than to change the size of the movie file when in video mode.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Trytten
Reviews.Content: I am baffled by the other reviews that say this camera takes poor quality images. Mine are sharp and clear with beautiful color and light balance. It's easy to use and incredibly portable. I previously had a Casio Exlim and was very disappointed. The Casio had a nasty habit of turning on when in my pocket which played havoc with the lens extender. It finally just stopped working. I can put the Nikon in my pocket and go, no worries, no problems. People are amazed at the picutures and video I take with this little wonder. I highly recommend this camera to others. Based on what they have seen of my photography with this camera, some of my friends have purchased one as well.

Reviews.Title: not too bad =]
Reviews.Author: ambiguous12
Reviews.Content: this camera was purchased under a budget i had myself stay on recently. i loved how small this camera is. its very conveniant for me to bring everywhere. i myself dont like bringing purses for some odd reason so i leave it in my pocket and it fits perfectly. the results of the pictures were okay but for the price i purchased it with...isnt too bad. try it out if you were looking for a low budget and cute looking camera. when they say it will be shipped between 1- 2 weeks it will take two weeks to ship it most likely

Reviews.Title: nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Sharon Hamill "librarian"
Reviews.Content: just what we wanted . very easy , small, with alot of nice features. pictures turn out great !  thanks

Reviews.Title: We love this camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Oberle "Oberle3"
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for only 6 months but love it! We have had no trouble with it until I dropped in on the hardwood floor today. Being my fault, I can't complain about it. Since the one we have is now getting repaired, I went ahead and ordered another one because we need it for vacation. It is super easy to use and we get 8X10 pictures made all the time and they look great! You can print up to 16X20 and still get a good quality. Easy, you can crop on the touchscree which is great. It's small and easy to handle/use. Clear pictures. I love it over the Canon Powershot we were using.

Reviews.Title: Buyers remorse!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Mccleaf
Reviews.Content: The camera takes very average pictures. The touch screen is confusing. And when the camera broke, after 4 months of minimal use, Nikon said the warranty did not apply. Stay away from this product! I will never buy a Nikon product again. I should have stuck with the Kodak reccomendations.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Murphy
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with a whole host of presets that allow you to take pictures in almost any setting, at the touch of the screen. Picture quality is great, 3x zoom is better than any the previous digital cameras i've owned and, given its diversity, it's good value for money.The touchscreen was one of the main reasons I bought this particular camera and although it did seem gimmicky at first, I soon found it a joy to operate. It takes a little while to get used to navigating through the touchscreen options, particularly if you're the owner of an IPod touch or IPhone. The camera doesn't operate in the same manner as those devices, but quick read through the manual and a bit of trial and error and it soon becomes second nature.If you're interested in purchasing a good quality, reasonably priced, fun digital camera then this is definately worth a look!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Matthew Gingles "Gingles"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with excellent picture quality, especially for the price.  The camera itself has several different options for shooting and it is somewhat simple.  It is very sleek and the portability is great!  It weighs next to nothing and fits pretty much anywhere you would carry a phone.  The only con to this product is the touch screen.  I am so used to my iPhone touchscreen being glass, this one feels like plastic.  It just seems cheap and it lacks sensitivity, sometimes I find myself mashing on it way too hard to get it to work.  Other than that, overall A+!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: K. Vaughn
Reviews.Content: I love taking pictures, and have an SLR digital camera, but was looking for a small, easy to transport camera that still took good quality pictures, but still at an affordable price. This camera was perfect for what I needed! LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: C. Scott
Reviews.Content: This item is just what was ordered.  The pictures are almost perfect and I love the color and touch pad.  It is so easy to use that my granddaughter wants one just like it.  Included in the package was battery, charger, usb and clear instructions.  I am extremely happy with this purchase and will recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Jiminylena
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before going on a trip, because my Nikon DSLR is a little big for convenience, and didn't want to risk it for underwater!  This little camera was easy to fit (see my other review) in the Dicapac pouch, and useful for grab-shots as well.  Although it doesn't zoom that far, I was able to crop in after-the-fact due to the large number of megapixels.  My only complaint is trying to see the screen in bright sun or underwater -- wish it had a small viewfinder, but guess that's a thing of the past.  The touch-screen aspect is good, but a little hard to learn -- takes some time to figure out which button to push to access the touch-screen, and then get rid of it.  But there's always a learning curve -- basically I like it a lot!  Image quality indoors and out was excellent.  As far as I'm concerned, you can't beat Nikon optics.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S320
Reviews.Author: C. Dittoe
Reviews.Content: This was bought as a gift for my daughter and she loves it!!! The ease of use, the clarity of the pictures and the battery length are all positives. The only drawback is that it uses a specialized battery rather than double A ones. I would certainly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: light and simple
Reviews.Author: technowizz "technowizz"
Reviews.Content: the camera is quick and easy to use and compact. It is well worth the money for the technology. Its my second nikon and by far the best in its price range. I was also able to get a second battery for 6 bucks.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Stelios Georgiou
Reviews.Content: nice handy camerapictures not sharp but ok if you set to normal mode

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Raquel Bonifacio "Raquel"
Reviews.Content: This is the most horrible-quality you can buy with your money.  I don't know where the 10MP are, but certainly not in this camera.  The pictures are grainy and just overall awful.  I played around with the settings not no avail.  A 1.3MP camera yields better pictures.  I returned this item the next day.  Will never purchase a camera over the Internet unless I go to a store and test it first.  Just trust me, not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Terrible pictures
Reviews.Author: G. Bailey "luckyfour"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my daughter.  After reading the previous review, I decided to take a few trial pictures before giving it as the gift.  All the pictures that were taken indoors with and without flash were not focused correctly.  The pictures that were taken outside were OK.  However, for a brand new camera that is not necessary a steal in price you should be able to expect better pictures.  I have never had a problem with any of my other cameras.  Too bad, as it appeared to be a fun camera with all the specials.  We sent it back!

Reviews.Title: Nikon made a mistake with camera....
Reviews.Author: MaiduCali
Reviews.Content: The pictures are grainy... everything else is ok, but the pictures come up crappy! I have a 7mp camera that takes better pictures then this camera. The color is cute, but I suggest not getting it. I tried everything to see if the picture could be sharper, but nothing works. Don't get it.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Miriam G. Gaenicke "mgaenicke"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! For a novice, it's great for my needs and it's also my first one. My BF has a Nikon and I loved it. SO FAR SO GREAT! ....It's loaded with goodies and does the job. Lighweight, cute and FUN! What else do I need??Cheers!gabi

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: Camera worked very well...but don't take it too the beach and walk backwards filming pelicans flying overhead and then fall over me get sand in the lens and then close the lens cover ...instant death.

Reviews.Title: MY  FAVORITE CAMERA  AND  FINALLY REPLACED
Reviews.Author: candyman
Reviews.Content: HAD THIS SAME CAMERA STOLEN OUT OF MY CAR WHILE AT THE TROLLEY PARKING LOT. WITH NEARLY 1500 PICS IN IT ON THE MEMORY CARD. CAN REPLACE MY FAVORITE CAMERA,BUT WHAT CAN YOU DO FOR THE MEMORIES????

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Mary Rose
Reviews.Content: The camera is great, works awesomely and takes amazing pictures.  I take it with me wherever I go! Like Bazinga!

Reviews.Title: It may be broken
Reviews.Author: Teresa Gaines
Reviews.Content: I think of this product like I think of a used car.  It could look good on the outside but it really experienced hale damage & the engine is 200 miles from needing a total overhaul.  I have not been able to take a single picture with this camera yet.  I'm going to search for a better camera on Amazon.  I will not give up.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pictures! No More Green Food Photos!
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: One of my daughters, knowing that I had become very frustrated with the AA-battery powered point & shoot that has been turning all of my food photos green and using up an entire set of batteries every time I transferred pictures to the computer for processing recently gave me this Nikon Coolpix S230 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 3 inch Touch Panel LCD (Plum) and I've been having a lot of fun with it. (No more green food photos!)Nikon Coolpix S230 is easy to learn to use, takes both stills and video and features a large touch screen (no reading glasses required.)  Lightweight, it easily fits into a purse. The removable battery is rechargeable and pictures are easily transferred to your computer or printer.Grandma's $0.02 - Love this easy-to-use camera.

Reviews.Title: Fine little fragile camera
Reviews.Author: pishta
Reviews.Content: BADNo USB port for chargingfragile touch screen, 2 foot drop onto tile broke minegrainy indoor pics out of flash rangeGOODSmall, great cam for outdoor picsexternal battery chargerinexpensive SDHC cardlarge touch screen has good menuBought this as a replacement for a Sony DSC-1 which we loved but lost on a bus. I was apprehensive buying a telescoping lens camera as I have heard so much about these lenses jamming or malfunctioning but the price was great and Nikon is a good brand name. First thing I noticed was that it came with a battery charger. OK, that's something else we will have to pack, can I charge it off the USB cable to the laptop? NO. You cant charge it via USB. Not even a trickle charge. Wait, thats not even a USB port, its a proprietary socket that the Nikon cable fits into. I guess micro USB cant do what this A/V out cable can do. OK, well move on..Started snapping pics. They look nice, not real grainy indoors, great outdoors. Turned off flash and zoomed in on a church choir, grainy as heck. Must have been the digital zoom on top of no flash which would have been out of range anyway. The high ISO they claim seems to introduce alot of grain as expected. And as for blurry motion shots, I have plenty. Either we are not using the sports mode or this camera doesnt really have that good of a sensor? OK, so it was only $60 off a surplus web site and it did have that cool touch screen so I think as bad as it is, its actually pretty good for $60. The touch screen comes with a little stylus that ties to the lanyard. The stylus makes using the touch screen bearable as your big fingers are pretty clunky on that little 3 inch screen. As for durability, The case is plastic and the chassis seems to be metal as there is some weight to it, but I dropped it from literally 2 feet off my lap to a tiled floor and sure enough I cracked the touch screen overlay, rendering it stuck on the last mode it was in as the touch screen is now unresponsive, its done. I dropped that Metal Sony DSC-1 from 5 feet and it only bounced and hit again and sustained no catastrophic damage. So the camera is not bad in my opinion for $60. It is bad for $200 though as you can get a tough camera from other makers that is much sturdier without the telescoping lens for about the same retail price.

Reviews.Title: So Disappointed!!!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Little
Reviews.Content: I bought a previous Nikon Coolpix camera in Europe and loved it.  When I lost that one I replaced it with this one.  The pictures were poor.  Its stopped holding a charge.  The touch screen was not intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S230
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: I love this Camara!!! The best feature on it is that you can hold the button down and take 6 consecutive pictures making it great for catching the right shot with a moving grandchild. I find that when I use that feature I get several shots that I want to keep and delete the ones that I don't.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s230
Reviews.Author: gg
Reviews.Content: I received the s230 camera and all the parts that go with it. Camera was in very good condition. Never thought i would buy a camera on amazon. Still working fine.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: monkeldad
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my daughter and she has never complained so it must be good!we have had it for 2 years now without a problem and it takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: Sad Day For The Nikon Brand
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Ruslander
Reviews.Content: Having been a fan of the Nikon brand since the early 70s, I was eager to try this inexpensive point and shoot digital model. I actually bought 2; one for my wife and one for my daughter. I was very disappointed with the photo quality of this camera. As other reviewers stated, outdoor snaps in bright light seem to fare acceptably, however almost every other lighting condition fails miserably to produce a photo that is not blurry or has low muddy contrast. ISO 80 seems to be the clearest setting, but is not conducive to shooting in all lighting conditions. While Nikon still produces some of the best cameras and lens systems in the world, my next point and shoot will be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, I've had it for three years!
Reviews.Author: Melanie L. Goddard
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for three years, and with a little use of the manual (genius right?) I've taken alot of fantastic pictures.  I took it on vacation to Disneyworld in 2008, and am so glad I did!  Along with a 16gb SD card and a couple of extra batteries, I was able to take thousands of pictures a day, 95% of them perfect!  Just a warning, you can't use both continuous mode and flash.  It takes a second or two for the flash to recharge, so in low light situations, don't expect extreme speed.  In high light (outside) it takes fantastic pictures on continuous, and your slide shows can look like still frame movies :)  I have so many pictures taken of my daughter at the play ground and theme parks when she was moving fast and it tracked right along, and at the San Diego Zoo of Tigers playing.  I've gotten two more coolpix since then, and love having camera's that I can interchange SD cards and batteries on!

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: virtual shopper
Reviews.Content: I so regret buying this camera.  It's been over a year since I purchased it and I only used it twice.  And both times the pictures were so bad it was unusable.  My oldest 3 megapixel camera takes better pictures.  I thought the touchscreen would be cool but again it was a big disappointment.  I've always had Canons in the past and thought i'd try a Nikon.  It was a big mistake.  I've been back to using my old Canon camera for now.

Reviews.Title: Very Dependable
Reviews.Author: Mise
Reviews.Content: The camera is very inexpensive and has all of the modern capabilities. I would recommend anyone to buy it that has a need for something simple but nice.

Reviews.Title: Nice design but picture quality not so good
Reviews.Author: Mystery Girl "Everybody wants to be someone e...
Reviews.Content: I don't own this camera my family member does. When I first took a picture it was very grainy but I realised I had it on high ISO so I reverted it back to normal settings and the grainyness was gone. My biggest complaint are the colors are off. My 6 mp camera from kodak displays the colors more accurately. The camera takes pictures better than my kodak.One thing I do like as a feature of my klunky big kodak over the nice sleak nikon is a physical dial changing camera settings (like video and taking pictures up close). Nikon's touch screen is slow and has 18 little icons for the different settings. I didn't read the manual and soe of the icons I'm not familiar with so I had to guess. I don't mind most of the time taking a few seconds longer to switch between setting but sometimes you're a bit too late to take a pic.It's a good camera for the price (when my family member bought hers it was $130 I believe, for $100 it's a fair price). The colors are just off in some places.

Reviews.Title: S230 HORRIBLE picture quality
Reviews.Author: jj2me
Reviews.Content: I am SO disgusted with this camera! Does not take good pictures indoors (about cell phone quality and not the iphone, which blows this camera away!). Very soft, and sometimes hazy, and the subject is about 10' away (with or without flash). Outdoors the picture quality improves, but only in good sun light. I've had this camera for about a year and have tried various settings hoping to get the quality to improve, but to no avail. I've done resets on it to return it to manufacturing settings, and still very poor quality. I am very disappointed in this product, especially since it came from Nikon. I have a few digital camera's and purchased this one because of it's features and being a name brand. BIG mistake. Do not waste your money on this.My Sony Mavica 1.2 megapixel floppy disk camera takes better quality pictures then this Coolpix camera and I am not lying.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Rosalie Bernardi
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my son as a Christmas gift. I should have listened to the negative reviews! He took less than 100 photos within the first month of using the camera and it stopped working because of a LENS ERROR two days before he was leaving for a trip to Italy!  We have to purchase another camera for him to take with him on the trip and it most definitely won't be a NIKON COOLPIX which is junk!

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Fame
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my girlfriend as a birthday gift. Out of the box it is sexy and high tech. Very impressed with the functions and the image quality on this unit. Want one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: steelejeff
Reviews.Content: I had to send it back to the manufacturer twice because of a "lens error." It was a huge hassle and took over a month and a half for them to return and repair. Not worth it. There are plenty of other cameras out there.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera with nice features
Reviews.Author: Pato Arvizu
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a Christmas gift for my wife and she loved it. Even though it's not iPhone-like touch screen, there's still the feeling that you can do everything with your fingers. The fact that it has very few buttons, makes the screen bigger, plus the camera itslef is very lightweight.There are still more features that we haven't explored, but we like what we've seen so far, including the smile mode and the continuous shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gina A. Melchor
Reviews.Content: So far it's lated me a good 2 years!  I have not experienced any problems whatsoever!!!!  If you buy this camera and think the picture is grainy than PLEASE CHANGE THE SETTINGS!!! The picture does not look like this!!!!  READ YOUR MANUAL!!!  The picture is great and everything worked fine for me!

Reviews.Title: Plain Awful
Reviews.Author: M. Tomaszewski "cleojo42"
Reviews.Content: This seems to be a very nice compact camera. There are many settings for the user to choose from. The navigation is good. The LCD screen is bright and large. However, the pictures are awful.Several of the settings are useless. Fireworks, for example, has such a long exposure time, that you need a tripod for it to get a crisp picture. And this thing is tiny, so it would look ridiculous on any tripod, even a gorilla pod. Any night pictures are hideous and grainy. Adding digital zoom makes things awful. And the while balance is very off.I should have kept my old cannon, as it took much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Worst point and shoot I've used
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I've been using a Canon 50d DSLR and a Canon Powershot (for portability). I won this camera in a company contest, and was excited since I'd never used a Nikon camera before and had heard nothing but quality things about NikonUsing this camera has made me happy I've never used a Nikon product in the past.  I did read the manual, and I did change the settings before I started using it.First off, the camera is lightweight, which is good.  Auto mode, which is seriously the bread and butter of any small, portable camera like this, is completely worthless. I'm not just talking about auto scene mode either, I'm talking about auto flash. Every photo I shot using auto-scene didn't come out properly, and part of that problem is the auto-focus.  Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what it's trying to focus on most of the time.  I'd go to shoot an Easter basket, it'd focus on the couch next to the basket.  I'd go to shoot my child reading a book, it'd focus on the carpet he's sitting on. I'm saavy enough to know that once the camera focuses, you can move it to put the green box over what you really want to focus on (as long as the depth is the same), but that never helped/worked.  Every photo wasn't as crisp/sharp as I would have expected.Auto-flash is just as bad. I'm indoors, at dusk, so it's not that bright, and the flash won't go off.  I'm down the basement, taking photos of the dogs, and the flash won't go off.  At first I gave the camera the benefit of the doubt and assumed it knew what it was doing, but all the photos came out dark and blurry.All the reviews say to use the scenes instead, so I started doing that.  Well, there is no scene for "I'm just shooting photos indoors", that's called "auto mode".  I did try various scenes while I was outside, and those photos came out better, but seriously, the whole point of auto mode is so you don't have to think about the composition of every photo. If I wanted to do that, I'd use my DSLR (and even then, sometimes auto mode is the easiest thing on that).I'm completely unimpressed with this camera.  I gave it 2 stars instead of 1, because if you can hit upon a photo you want to take that the scene mode takes care of, it's not horrible.  However for something that's horrendously easy to use with little thought, go with a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality Surprise
Reviews.Author: Lori Pitsas
Reviews.Content: I got this Camera for my birthday back in October and was exited to get to use it. But shortly after I opened it, I was a little discouraged. The picture quality was not good at all. Most of the time it would be "grainy" or quite blurry. And even if the picture looked good on the big touch screen, once I put them onto my laptop the quality became even worse. The indoor quality was the worse of all the settings (which is where I use it the most), but the only upside was it did wonderful in natural, bright light.Overall as my second point-and-shoot camera, I was unsatisfied.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: T. Taddeo
Reviews.Content: Well worth the moneyTakes great pictures!AND love that its a touch screen!!

Reviews.Title: Just the perfect size.
Reviews.Author: MARICOR
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves it.  The camera is so thin that perfectly fits in her pocket. She also indicated that it is so easy to use.  By the way, she is only 13 years old.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: David P. "ROUSHAC"
Reviews.Content: Got it for my daughter, but I occasionally use it.We both agree that it has excellent picture and video qualityfor a camera at this price point, and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Stacey L. Fletcher "Staceyf"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! So easy my 10 year old can use with ease! All the little "extra features" are awesome. Good picture quality would def. recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for everyone
Reviews.Author: Nathan C. Rice "Nathan"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my mom for Christmas. She opened it up and was taking pictures 5 minutes later. Her eyesight isn't great, so the huge screen helps her see what she's shooting, and the touchscreen makes navigating the controls simple too. She loves it, and the pictures look great.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Theresa "Theresa"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Canon less than a year ago and hated it. It was to slow due to the regular batteries. Fed up, I researched and found this one. This camara is easy, fast and takes great photos for the low cost. Love the touchscreen thought sometimes it can be fussy.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Ramirez Orozco
Reviews.Content: Great camera.The quality of the screen isn't the best, but it gets the job done really fine.Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Do not recommend~~You can get a better camera for same price range
Reviews.Author: KiKi
Reviews.Content: First off I'm not a "newbie" when it comes to digital cameras and as much as I wanted to like this camera it was returned.  Even my 9 yr old (who the camera was bought for) thought the pictuers were horrible.Pros:*Easy to use.  The menu layout was simple and easy to navigate even for a 9 yr old.*Touch screen works well and is fun to use--Reason my son was set on this particular camera.*Many "auto" scenes to chose fromCons:*Screen is horrible.  Everything looks grainy on the screen.*Picture quality is mediocre at best.  Pictures do look better once uploaded to a computer compared to the screen, but the camera does not take consistent good pictures.  It's hit or miss and most when fully enlarged are just horrible.  If you're going to just print small pictues 5 by 7 or smaller they'd probably turn out OK, but anything larger you will probably see the "noise" in the prints.*Video quality is not the greatest--very grainy even in good light conditionsI played with this camera for days on different settings and could not get it to take good consistent pictures.  I ended up returning the Nikon and picked up a Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Dark Gray).  It may not have a "cool" touchscreen but the pictures are awesome.

Reviews.Title: What a bargain!
Reviews.Author: Cesar Ponciano "mixerone"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my Sister for Christmas and It is an awesome camera. I own the S60 (which is more expensive) and the S230's picture quality and responsiveness is superior.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: M. DeRamus "Melanie"
Reviews.Content: I've purchased several HP and Kodak camera's in the past but this is the first time I've owned/tried a Nikon and must say that it's the best by far.  I love the touch screen and the option of being able to write your messages right onto the picture.  I would definitely purchase from Nikon again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Wife Loves It
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A Haller Sr "Ken"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, she has a Fuji 7000 and a Kodak Digital sorry I don't remember the model it's a good camera but a few years old.  Anyway she and I are "Seniors" 65+ She has difficultly with complex menus.  Out of the box she was taking good pictures, and enjoying all the (well some) of the features .  Now she is reading the manual.  Her comment last night was "I'll never use all the things this camera has."  So, bottom line, great gift she likes it and is using it over her more expensive Fuji .I have a Nikon Coolpix 8700, which is an excellent camera.  I am a photography enthusiast I had one of my photos (taken with the 8700) selected by a TV station and have had a few selected for publishing in a local pamphlet.  After my wife's experience and my using her S230 I've ordered one for myself.  Besides it's a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: GREAT THINGS COME IN SMALL PACKAGES.
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Riggs
Reviews.Content: great camera at a great value.i agree with those that say read the manual.sometimes you have to use common sense and a little effort.the camera works great and has a lot of nice features in a small package.Mike

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Letty Lindsey
Reviews.Content: very happy with my item i contacted the vendor before shipping and received my camera before the ship date very good experience

Reviews.Title: No good
Reviews.Author: G. Delong "Guy"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to "upgrade" from a Panasonic 7MP camera that's 2-3 years old.  This Nikon is terrible.  Bad color, pixely pics and LCD screen.  We sent it back and are happy continuing to use our old camera for now.

Reviews.Title: not a good camera
Reviews.Author: L. Acevedo
Reviews.Content: I recently got this camera and was quite excited about the touchscreen and the price.  I used the camera in mu home and all the pictures on the screen were either blurry or grainy.  I read the instruction manual and spend 2-3 hours trying to figure out different combinations to adjust the picture.  I am done.  I am packing it up and returning it.  I am going to look for a canon or sony.

Reviews.Title: Not what I wanted but its ok
Reviews.Author: M. G. Harris
Reviews.Content: I'm still figuring out the ins and outs of this camera. Initially I placed a Pre-Order for the Silver Nikon but after nearly two months I still did not have my camera although other venders were selling it and I needed it for vacation. I called Amazon and they shipped this one to me expedited and took off $20.00 so I can't complain. It is a cute camera but it doesn't, or I haven't figured out how to make it, take good pictures of kids on the move. The pictures are grainy and often out of focus. I might have invested a little more money into a camera that was better at taking action shots. A plus is the touch screen, that feature I love. So all in all it's ok but I would have gone with a diffrent camera.

Reviews.Title: The worst image quality
Reviews.Author: B. Yu
Reviews.Content: This camera looks very cute. But the image quality is the worst. I never knew that different brands of camera could have so big quality differences; how can a camera survive with this image quality? It's even not cheap among this category of camera.

Reviews.Title: Terrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: J. Wouw
Reviews.Content: This camera has terrible picture quality. The images are either too washed out, blurred, grainy, etc. Let's just say I am returning it within a day of receiving it. DO NOT BUY unless you don't care.

Reviews.Title: 4 stars so far
Reviews.Author: MyPenName
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it is very visually appealing. The plum color is beautiful, it is sleek, thin, lightweight and looks perfect.The touch screen is easy to use and making using the camera very easy. It is much nicer to go through the settings with the touch screen, rather than have to use buttons.The picture quality is pretty good. You really have to use the settings that are available in order to get good pics. If you just pop the battery in and start snapping pics they will be grainy/blurry. Read the manual and learn the settings. "Play" around with it for a while before using it on a special occasion and you will have much better results.I bought this for my 13 year old daughter for Christmas and she loves it. I like it so much that I might buy one for myself. I am in love with the color and overall sleek feel and look.

Reviews.Title: Extremely poor quality rate it at 5 on a 100 point scale
Reviews.Author: Gagan Chopra "Gagan"
Reviews.Content: There couldn't be a worse performing camera than this. We have a D200 that we use for most occasions; and got this to keep with us for a european trip; and boy we couldn't have done our selves a worse service when it came to capturing memories. The quality of pictures is extremely poor for all kinds of pictures.There's really nothing more to say for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Only a statue can get a clear picture
Reviews.Author: Jaxi Casper
Reviews.Content: My main complaint with this camera is that you have to be stock still when taking a photo or it is blurry.  Even when I have placed the camera on a stable surface I have had blurry pictures.  Night mode and dusk/dawn modes are the worst.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Darlene Henry "Darlene"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! I would recommend everyone that is looking for a great camera.

Reviews.Title: The worst digital camera I've ever used
Reviews.Author: Kurt Burnside
Reviews.Content: This camera is, without a doubt, the worst digital camera I've ever used. And for those of you who say that reading the instruction manual is the answer, I will have to disagree. Sure, the compact design and touch-screen interface are nice, but who cares about those features if the photo quality is garbage! I tried taking several pictures right out of the box on auto-mode and found the image quality to be worse than my first digital camera that I bought back in 1995. I thought that I had to be doing something wrong so I broke down and read the entire instruction manual. I tried taking pictures on each of the scene settings, and still found that the image quality was terrible (some worse than others).  After messing around with this camera for approximately 3 hours, I finally decided to look online to see if there was something I was missing. That's when I found all of the negative reviews from others about the picture quality. I'm a pretty tech-savvy guy, and operating a consumer-grade digital camera shouldn't be rocket science. I've always been a Canon camera fan (I love my EOS Digital Rebel SLR camera), so I decided to exchange this Nikon for the Canon PowerShot SD1200 IS.  Man, am I glad I did!!! Right out of the box, the Canon took amazing pictures. I'll never try a Nikon again!!!

Reviews.Title: Save your money
Reviews.Author: C. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Mother's Day.  I've been frustrated with my old one because the shutter wasn't quick enough to keep up with my 2 year old and her baby brother, so my husband bought this one because we like touch screens and it was 10 MP (my old one is 7).  The shutter speed is definitely quicker, but every picture I take is blurry, the screen is grainy, and the movies are also low quality.  It's boxed up, ready to go back.  We're going to try a Cannon instead.

Reviews.Title: Has potential but failed to impress.
Reviews.Author: J. Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed Nikon projects and have always had a very positive view of their products. I can not say that about this camera. I bought this camera and returned it after using it for about a week. I am shocked that Nikon has released a product that simply doesn't take good pictures. 90% of the pictures I took with this camera where one of the following:1) Out of focus2) Very noisy3) Colors where wrongWith that being said, I did like the 3.0" LCD touch screen and the overall build of the camera. I would even say that I like everything else about the camera other then the picture quality.I have returned this camera (btw, returning an item to Amazon is very quick and easy.) and replaced it with a Samsung SL820 12MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0 inch LCD (Black) and I've been very very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: WORST CAMERA EVER!!
Reviews.Author: C. Gallo
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about getting this camera when I ordered it. I had seen the commercials with Ashton Kutcher swiping his finger across the screen to sift through his photos. I had read Nikon's sales pitch describing the user's ability to write on the pictures with the included stylus. I had watched the demonstrations on-line showing how the camera knows whether or not someone is smiling or blinking. And being a big technology guy, this was all very cool stuff.Unfortunately, Ashton Kutcher lied to me! Well, maybe not really. But this camera is terrible! The pictures it takes are grainy, fuzzy, blurry and almost never in focus. The 3" LCD screen is made of plastic and feels VERY cheap. The images on it are far from crystal clear- Hey Nikon, Apple knew enough to ditch the plastic screen on its iPhone before it was released, you should do the same with this thing!I also had issues with the smile mode and blink proof functions, which is to say they didn't work. In fact, the camera almost never recognized where the subject's face was in the photo.Believe me when I say I spent hours reading through the manual and adjusting the settings on the camera in an effort to improve the picture quality. Alas, the problem was with the device and not the user.In the end, I sent the Nikon back and instead purchased a Samsung SL620. I'll let you know how it is once I've used it a bit - it just arrived today. But do yourself a favor and steer clear of this one, it's hopeless!

Reviews.Title: perfect take anywhere camera
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to put in my pocket and take everywhere and was surprised that it took wonderful pictures! Much better picture quality than I expected.

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: lisa lowe
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!  I LOVE IT WORKED BEAUTIFULLY TOOK GREAT PICS AND STILL DOES WORKED JUST LIKE THEY SAID IT WOULD!

Reviews.Title: Meh ...
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: Camera is fully functional however the technology is a bit behind. Pictures are as crisp as they could be. Camera functions are a bit slow. All in all, there are better cameras out there!

Reviews.Title: worst camera purchase ever.
Reviews.Author: tmommy
Reviews.Content: I bought this over a year ago on black Friday, with help from a "photographer enthusiast" friend. Well needless to say it was terrible advice. For people who are used to shooting with DSLR's to tell someone that Nikon set industry standards in cameras is very misleading. Maybe Nikon can produce top of the line DSLR's, but their point and shoot's SUCK!This camera was supposed to be an upgrade from a Kodak Easyshare I bought in 2005. That was a decent camera, but it was 4 years old which is practically extinct in camera years. I was so sad to discover that my shot-to-shot comparisons between this and the Kodak camera were not even close. These pictures ALWAYS come out blurrier, no matter what setting i used, and the color was yellower overall.Sadly for me I was so busy after I bought it with the holidays that I didn't discover how crappy this thing is until after the 30-day return window had passed from the retailer I purchased it from. After that I kept using my Kodak until it finally stopped working. So now I'm using this solely because it's the only camera I have until I can save up to buy a better camera (definitely won't go near Nikon point and shoot again).Maybe this is ok for an occasional user who doesn't care about getting anything developed larger than 3x5, or maybe using pics for their tiny facebook profile. It take decent pics outside in full sunlight (but what camera doesn't?), but if you're trying to shoot kids indoors then just forget about it.I will say that the video quality is decent, and that's the reason that I gave this 2 stars instead of 1. But if i wanted to get a camera for purely a video functions I would have gotten a camcorder!I cannot emphasize this enough:DO NOT BUY THIS!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix review
Reviews.Author: CHARLOTTE
Reviews.Content: This camera was a big dissappointment, it looked new as was advertised by seller but the touchscreen was blurry possibly refurbished and the pictures were awful. I also had to send several emails to just get a refund. Rec'd refund on 11/29/10 and the seller rec'd my return on 11/18/10. Will not buy from 3rd party again on amazon.

Reviews.Title: Hunk of Junk
Reviews.Author: GlamGab
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for christmas in 2009. I absolutely loved it...while it lasted. The pictures were definitely an upgrade compared to my 3 yr old Exilim. Then five months went by and I tried to turn on but it kept saying "lens error". This is after the fact that I took extremely good measures to keep camera safe and out of harms way ie.no dropping, banging, kept in a protective case etc. I tried to fix myself and after wiping lens carefully with a q-tip it worked again.Sadly, I found myself in the same situation not 1 month later. However, this time it not only read "lens error" but also made a buzzing/beeping noise as the lens went in and out. This time no matter what I tried to do it simply was not going to work again. I don't feel like spending hundreds to send it to Nikon and have it repaired when I can simply purchase a better camera for the same price....completely disgusted by this and the fact that Nikon doesn't cover this under warranty due to "mishandling of user". I was soooooo careful yet got jipped in the end..Thanks for nothing Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is the worst
Reviews.Author: S. Duvuri
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture ("in whatever mode it is") is the worst.Pictures are so dull and blurred. I would recommend not to buy this camera.If a camera cannot take good pictures, other features like touch screen does not matter.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it.
Reviews.Author: Jerry C. Nolte "Emmy"
Reviews.Content: I am very dissapointed with this camera. When I got my 1st one it had a dent on the front. I returned it and I got a new one in the mail a few days later. I was happy with this one until it got a crack in the screen. Now I can't delete photos, or edit them. I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Far from the Best
Reviews.Author: LakeHMM
Reviews.Content: This isn't that great of a camera.  The touch-screen barely works.  You have to press it a million times for it to MAYBE recognize what you're trying to click.  Another really annoying thing is that you can't get pictures off the camera the same way you can with every other digital camera.  They make you use their awful Nikon Transfer software, which doesn't even recognize the camera when I plug it in, which means I can't get anything off of the camera.  Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but not for the price
Reviews.Author: Kroy Rowe "Roni Rowe"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because our old GE was lost on our last trip.  I saw the ad for it, and thought the touch screen was pretty cool!  I am taking it back as SOON as the Christmas mall rush is over.  It is small, which is good for some,and bad for others.  It was ok at first, but it is just too small to hold on to to take the picture.  That is MINOR and I could live with it.  The thing I can't is the blurry pictures!  My old camera, a GE A730 took the best pictures!  My kids could be running and if I took the picture, it was clear as a bell.  With this camera, every picture I took of my child opening a present was blurry.  If there is ANY movement at all, it is blurry.  I read all the reviews about changing the ISO, or using the correct setting for the picture you are taking, but nothing helped. I even used the sport setting, figuring of COURSE that would be a setting that could compensate for motion, and it did a LITTLE better, but not much.  With 4 active kids, there is no way this camera will work for me!  Again, all the research I did about reading the manual, or changing the setting didn't work at all! I am on the computer right now trying to find my old GE A730 to buy again....now THAT is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Never buy Nikon!!
Reviews.Author: Joo Han Song "NeverbuyNikon"
Reviews.Content: I bough it for my 12 year old daughter a couple of months ago. She dropped it on her desk lightly when she took out the memory card. Though it was a slight impact, the lens was stock and never worked. I asked to repair it, but some days later I received a call from Nikon to ask me to pay more than $130 for the lens because it's our fault!! Whose responsibility is the weak body of the camera? What terrible!! They should have made a strong camera. My young daughter's dream camera has gone forever with a very slight impact and the poorest service of Nikon. If you read my review, think again about Nikon. If I were you, I would never buy Nikon!!

Reviews.Title: Super poor digital camera
Reviews.Author: Sanghee Lee
Reviews.Content: As soon as receive that item, I try to use that camera but it's quality is too poor, so, I disappointed about Nikon camera and I never again buy this brand camera.

Reviews.Title: Touchscreen is nice to have, but HORRIBLE picture quality
Reviews.Author: H. Patel
Reviews.Content: Indoor and Outdoor pictures are very noisy/grainy.  A lot of the pictures were severely out of focus (even at the point where the camera shows it focused).  Outdoor performance is better than indoor, but still very poor.  I bought the Canon 790IS (same price as Nikon at Costco) to do comparison shots.  The 790IS outperformed the Nikon in all departments.  Don't waste your money and time on Nikon s230.

Reviews.Title: Pictures not clear
Reviews.Author: Sue W. Bowman "Harley rider"
Reviews.Content: I was not pleased with the quality of the pictures this camera produced.  I tried all the different settings and no matter what I did the pictures were grainy and not crisp.  I returned the camera to the company I purchased it from.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed!!!
Reviews.Author: KPW
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera regardless of the bad reviews.  I guess I had to see for myself.  Everyone has a different opinion, right?  Well, they were right.  The camera itself has nice features (touch screen, write and add captions to pictures), but does not justify the quality of the pictures and prints.  The LCD is very grainy, often with snow, no matter what settings I used.  I kept having to adjust settings every time I took a picture.  Who wants to stop every time to make sure they have the correct setting.  So, this is not just a point and shoot.  I have a high end Canon Rebel XT EOS and just wanted a small digital to keep in my purse.  Maybe I'm just spoiled by the quality in my high end SLR. I thought Nikon had been around long enough to produce great products.  I was disappointed enough that I boxed it up and shipped it back after two days.  I went with the Canon Powershot SD780 IS instead and love it!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: Dan@Peru "Dan"
Reviews.Content: when I saw this item, S230; I thought it was like S225 but with touchscreen. It turned out to be similar to S220, which is together with this one a waste of money. Pictures taken are usually blur, or have lots of back-light dots. Auto mode is really crappy :S:S:S totally dissatisfied with it. Thought for being a Nikon it'd have been a better product. Couldn't be more wrong. For less price I can get a Casio that does much better with less money. So.. no.... it's not good.

Reviews.Title: Austin Kucher should go back to That 70's Show
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera stinks, aweful pics.  Also its hard to hold on to.  Sucks, buy a canon.

Reviews.Title: horrible picture quality!
Reviews.Author: D. Gong
Reviews.Content: My dad just got one as a graduation gift for my cousin.  We tried to take a few photos to test it and the picture quality was horrid.  I cannot believe in this day and age Nikon would make something so inferior and dare to put their name on it.  I own a Nikon D50, have owned Canon S30, A90 and Canon A570 IS.  All of them take pictures with qualities WAY better than this S230.  I do not recommend this camera!  Dad will return this camera tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: Cassandra L. Harr
Reviews.Content: My husband recently bought this camera for my b-day. We had a sony that was 7 years old and wanted a compact one to carry in the diaper bags. I took it out of the box and charged the battery but the pitcure quality was awful. Very grainy and can see the pixles. Seems like there was more input into the color and touch screen then the actual quality of the photo. We even downloaded the pictures to the computer and the quality was still awful. My husbands blackberry took better quality of photos than this camera. The camera can be deciving because my husband looked at it in the store and took photos in the store which came out okay. However in dim light and night photos, don't expect to get good pictures. So we returned it and got a sony cybershot and let me tell you the pictures were crystal clear. To rate the differences in cameras: the nikon is a  0% and sony 100%. When I buy a camera, I want good quality photos and could careless about a touch screen, etc. (The sony did have more features than the nikon, except for touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Bad Quality
Reviews.Author: Amy L. Baker
Reviews.Content: The touchscreen is cool, the color is nice but the quality of the pictures is horrible.  The Macro feature doesn't allow you to get close to the object.  The pictures when viewed on the camera screen are grainy so I uploaded them to my computer where they were just as bad.  I tried every setting, every light option...it is just an overall poor quality picture.  I am trying to get rid of it for a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice system; a few technological advances needed
Reviews.Author: Erik M. Gregory "egregory"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at a friend's suggestion.  The camera is good; but the touch screen technology is not there yet.

Reviews.Title: Why Nikon? Why?
Reviews.Author: B. Yee
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, I'm very disappointed.  I feel like I bought a product that should still be in R&D.;  Nikon should never release a product when it's not ready for prime time.  My biggest complaint is the picture quality in low light conditions.  It's grainy and blurry.  Even my 6 yr old Sony Cybershot performed better.  Nikon is really ruining their reputation when they release a product of such low quality.The only thing that I liked was the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: adequate photos, easy to use, cool looking, questionable buy
Reviews.Author: Lindy B
Reviews.Content: The photos are adequate.  You loose detail and get fuzzy photos without flash, even with good lighting.  I have a Casio QV-R51 (5 megapix) I am comparing it to.  The 3X optical cannot really be 3X!!  For $200+ I cannot see a significant difference with my 4 year old Casio with half the pix.  I like the size and weight.  The plastic container is painted to looked like a brushed aluminum.  I question how it would survive a fall.  Now, all Nikon has to do is make this camera take quality photos!

Reviews.Title: Pretty camera...not so pretty pictures.
Reviews.Author: Jorja Loughmiller
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (who has never owned and has barely used a digital camera) picked this Nikon out for me for my birthday.  Since he lacks any working experience with digital cameras, he based his selection on what he thought I would want:  cute design, "girly" color, large touch-screen operation and 10 or more megapixels.  While this camera has all of those characteristics, it's lacking a few other ones that are more important, like more than 3x optical zoom and better image stabilization.The pros: I love all of the preset modes--you can select the type of environment you're in (such as Museum, Fireworks, Sunset and more) to get the optimum settings for lighting, shutter speed and color.  Even though I haven't had much chance to use it, I also love the Panoramic Picture setting.  I tried it out the first night in our new apartment and it was a great way to take a shot of our entire living room and dining room to email out to family.  Can't wait to try this out somewhere a little more scenic!  Overall the camera is extremely easy to use and the large touch screen makes seeing and selecting things simple.The cons:  The pictures tend to be very grainy, no matter the distance.  The camera claims to have a 3x optical zoom, but my 5+ year old Sony Cybershot that cost half the amount and half the megapixels of this Nikon takes nearly the same quality.  The included software has some nice features, but again, I think the software I got from Sony is a little better.  Also don't like that this camera has a rechargeable battery--can be inconvenient when traveling or at long events when a power outlet is not an option.Overall, I like this camera and think it looks great.  I just wish that my boyfriend would have taken me shopping to let me chose my own camera, as I would have focused more on the technical specs of the camera than the aesthetics of it.

Reviews.Title: The best camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Camila M. Antiquera
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpiz S230 is the best camera. Take great pix!!! and the touch panel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: too soon to review
Reviews.Author: Grammy Photographer
Reviews.Content: the novelty of the touch screen is great but the intricacies of the camera are still an exploration for me...

Reviews.Title: prize is good for the camera
Reviews.Author: ZHUOYAO LI
Reviews.Content: It is not that thin as i imagine. but it is still good, very easy to use, plus a good prize.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves this camera
Reviews.Author: M. Weissman
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon Coolpix S230 for my daughter for her birthday and she absolutely loves it.

Reviews.Title: MUY BUENA MAQUINA
Reviews.Author: E. Ignacio "Nacho"
Reviews.Content: Creo que como otro cliente dice, hay que leer el manual para poder realmente entender como se usa esta máquina.  De todos modos configurandola en modo automático las fotos son fantásticas.  No es una máquina profesional, pero por ello nadie puede decir que sea mala, como he visto en otros comentarios.  Muy recomendable, facil de usar, precio, justo para lo que es.  La pantalla táctil es de lo mejor que vi, y las fotos son coloridas, brillantes, con mucha vida.  No hagan caso a los quejosos de siempre.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: Carlos Ramon Gil "carlos gil"
Reviews.Content: my request last year, to come back for allegedly shipping damage, I wonder, q happens I have ordered a new one, at least not my fault I have neglected q hope supronta response. ramon carlos gil writes them.

Reviews.Title: No es lo que pensaba
Reviews.Author: Joel R. Almodovar "el Terapista"
Reviews.Content: la camara es de 10 mega pixel pero al momento de aumentar el tamaño de la foto la calidad es pesima. no estoy totalmente satisfecho

Reviews.Title: Poor design and construction
Reviews.Author: K. Miller
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these (2 as X mas presents and 1 as a birthday present).  If I had only known how they were made I never would have bought one.  The lens is a piece of junk and just stops working for no apparent reason.  Two of the three had this problem.  I sent both of the cameras off under warranty.  What a hassle, Nikon sucks!!!They honored one under warranty and six weeks later they returned that camera.  The other one they demanded the receipt and we could not find it.  They want $ 108 to fix THEIR defect on a camera that retails at $ 145.  The camera has been at Nikon repair for months now, I don't think it will ever leave that place.  They refuse to stand behind their product, I refuse to ever have anything to do with them.The camera that did come back lasted less than one week.  My daughter took it with her on a class trip and put it in her backpack.  When she went to get the camera out of the backpack the touch screen was cracked.  The weight of other backpacks cracked that.  No use sending that into their warranty department...  they will never honor that.The third camera was dropped by my son while running on the driveway and is horribly scratched, ironically despite the cosmetic scratches that is the only one that has work perfectly.So, a lens that is defective, a touch screen that cannot stand normal wear and tear, built by a company that fails to stand behind their product.  Don't waste your money.

Nikon's Smart Portrait System; Red-eye Fix, Face Priority AE and more
